newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Danish Wise Men see 2.6 pct '97 inflation.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Danish Wise Men see 2.6 pct '97 inflation.

text.p: The independent Danish Economic Council said in its biannual report on Wednesday that it expected a 2.6 percent rise in consumer prices in both 1997 and 1998 and 1.9 percent in 1999 using domestic calculation methods, not the EU-harmonised formula.
In its previous report last November, the council, known as the Wise Men, also forecast inflation of 2.6 percent for this year, but predicted then that inflation would rise to 2.7 percent in 1998.
In 1996, Danish consumer prices rose 2.1 percent using the domestic calculation formula.
